In a few words

Mythic-Forge is an online game engine to create 2D, multi-player, turn-based games.

A limpid explanation, isn't it ? No it's not. So let's have a deeper look :)

From the peaks

So it's a game engine: you'll play the Game Designer part. Mythic-Forge which will allow you to create games, and is not a game itself.

Then it's online: it's composed of a server and a game client (a Web application), usable by your players with a r(d)ecent browser.

Please hover the scheme to detailled it.

Hyperion: the server

The server hosts and manages game's items (maps, characters, events...) and a complete set of game rules.

Theses rules will govern what players can do, and how the system will react.

The game client

It provides players with rendering and interaction mecanisms.

You will have total control on the game client: it's up to you to define its visual identity, to explain its rules, to add a blog, a forum, and anything you'll need to animate your community.

Let's dig a little further

Now that you've catch the general idea, let's see how to use Mythic-Forge.

Another web application is provided: it's the central tool to manage the whole system.

With this application, you'll handle all the server items, as well as the game client code.

Keyword is "live". No need to recompile anything. No need to manually restart or redeploy stuff. Just modify or add something, and you can use it immediately. Everything is live.

Rheia: the administration application

As Game Developper/Designer, it will allow you to:

  • Create and model your world. You'll set fields, items, characters properties. You'll design maps.
  • Write game rules. The rule engine gives you total control on how the system will act.
  • Code the game client. From a generic jumpstart code, you'll personalize your game client to gave it a unic and immersive behaviour.
  • Manage the running game. Once online, you can see and modify any item inside the world. Modifications are applied in real time. Omniscience and omnipresence !

Under the hood

Still here ? So you're really interested :)

Let's see the technologies involved.

Within Mythic-Forge, almost everything is in JavaScript. This language offers four significant advantages:

  1. Portability: implemented in all browsers worthy of the name, it allows playing on PC, smart-phones, tables an even Tv !
  2. Flexibility : interpreted and loosely typed, it offers the needed flexibility of a game that evolve continually.
  3. Runs on server and client: a single language for rules on server and game client. Less efforts to learn it, and possibility to share code on both sides, without sacrificing security.
  4. Tooled for rendering: web browsers now have all means to show a quality render, and all these means can be natively used from JavaScript

In return, it's a difficult language to master. It won't allow you (yet) to ship a 3D game, or to take part of players' accelerated hardware.

To efficientrly overcome JavaScript defects, you'll use CoffeeScript. This Ruby-inspired language generates a clean and optimized JavaScript code.

Hyperion

Engine: NodeJS, language: CoffeeScript. NodeJS uses V8 (the JavaScript engine of Webkits browsers), from which it has removed DOM facilities, and added files, sockets, processes...

Data are stored inside a MongoDB database: performance et flexibility.

All the game rules are written with CoffeeScript.

Communication with game clients is provided by Socket.io: everything is shipped by Websockets, a permanent bi-directionnal socket between server and browser.

Rheia

Written with CoffeeScript and using last HTML5 and CSS3 advances. It's really an Rich Internet Application (RIA).

It uses jQuery (DOM manipulations) and jQuery-UI (graphical widgets), RequireJS (script loader) BackboneJS (MVC code structuration).

Permanently connected thanks to Socket.io, it also uses Ace Editor to write code (game rules ans game client files).

The game client

Like Rheia, it's a Rich Internet Application written with JavaScript/HTM5/CSS3.

You'll be able to use JavaScript, CoffeeScript, Css3 and also Stylus.

A jumpstart kit (jQuery, jQuery-UI, RequireJS, BackboneJS) provides base functionnalities (map display, rules triggering...). But you'll be able to use any external library needed.

Up to you to enhanced it, and to infuse its unic personnality and Game Design. You'll need to modify it deeply to bring your players a real game experience !

Want to use it ?

It's your turn now !

Mythic-Forge is an Open Source product (lGPL v3), and uses only Open Source libraries and technologies. It means you can get the code and use it freely.

Go to Github to get the code and running instructions. Then, start it and begin to write your first game !
